titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the H. G. Nelson Logging Photographs circa 1900-1920
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by David Smestad

publicationstmt.publisher: Washington State University Libraries Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Suzanne James-Bacon. 2016
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English. English.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: The collection consists of about 100 2x2-inch slides of original prints of logging during the early years of the twentieth century around Hoquiam, Washington and also a microfilm of same.

bioghist.p: H. G. Nelson appears to have been a commercial photographer working out of Hoquiam, Washington during the early twentieth century. These photographs were taken for the Polson Brothers Logging Company, an ITT Rayonier predecessor.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of about 100 2x2-inch slides of original prints of logging during the early years of the twentieth century around Hoquiam, Washington and also a microfilm of same. Also included are photographs of Terry Abraham, Archives Librarian and G. Donald Smith, Director of the Library accepting the collection from ITT Rayonier representative Arden Kommer in 1976.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: H. G. Nelson Logging Photographs, circa 1900-1920 (PC 26)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: The photographs of H. G. Nelson were donated to the Washington State University Libraries by ITT Rayonier, Incorporated, in two parts in 1976 and 1977.

processinfo.p: This collection was processed by David Smestad in April, 1978.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
